meanings.definition: A musical technique involving the simultaneous sounding of two or more melodies.
meanings.sent1: The diaphony of the choir created a beautiful harmony.
meanings.sent2: The concert showcased the diaphony of the orchestra and the choir.
meanings.sent3: The diaphony of the birds chirping in the morning was like a natural symphony.
meanings.sent4: The diaphony of voices in the bustling market was a cacophony of sound.
meanings.sent5: The diaphony of the piano and violin blended seamlessly in the duet.

meanings.definition: A type of polyphony in which different voices or instruments sing or play different melodies simultaneously.
meanings.sent1: The medieval music featured intricate diaphony between the singers.
meanings.sent2: The diaphony of the instruments added depth to the musical performance.
meanings.sent3: The diaphony of the cats meowing in different pitches was oddly amusing.
meanings.sent4: The diaphony of opinions in the meeting made it hard to reach a decision.
meanings.sent5: The diaphony of the wind chimes in the garden created a peaceful atmosphere.
